grammar_point: より・のほか(に)(は)〜ない

dojg.grammar_point: より・のほか(に)(は)〜ない
dojg.description: A phrase that conveys the idea that there is no other choice than to do something, or that something is true of only one of a select few things.
dojg.meaning: There is no (other) choice but to; there is no other way than to; have to; nothing but; but; not ~ other than

examples.japanese: (ksa).公共の交通機関がないので、自分の車で行く(より)ほか(に)(は)ない。
examples.english: Since there is no public transportation, we have no other  choice but to go there in your/my car.

examples.japanese: (ksb).新聞はニューヨークタイムズのほか(に)は読まない。
examples.english: I read nothing but the New York Times. (literally: I don't read  any newspaper other than the New York Times.)

examples.japanese: (a).アルバイトの仕事が駄目になったので、両親にお金を借りるよりほかになかった。
examples.english: Because I lost my part-time job, I had no choice but to borrow  money from my parents.

examples.japanese: (b).友人がどうして気が狂ってしまったのかは推測するよりほかにはない。
examples.english: I can only speculate as to why my friend was acting crazy.

examples.japanese: (c).信号機の故障で電車が止まってしまった以上、待っているよりほかない。
examples.english: Since the train is stopped due to a signal problem we have no  choice but to wait.

examples.japanese: (d).国際的に活躍したければ英語を学ぶよりほかはないだろう。
examples.english: A person who wants to be internationally active will have no  choice but to learn English.

examples.japanese: (e).秩序を回復するには権威の力を直接見せつけた容赦ない手段をとるよりほかはない。
examples.english: In order to restore order, there is no other choice than to  take ruthless means, directly demonstrating the power of our authority.

examples.japanese: (f).モーツアルトが35年の生涯に６００曲以上の作品を書いたというのには、ただただ驚くよりほかはない。
examples.english: The fact that Mozart composed more than 600 pieces during his  life of thirty-ﬁve years is simply amazing (literally: leaves us no other  choice than to be surprised).

examples.japanese: (g).典型的な科学者のイメージに合う人はアインシュタインのほかにはない。
examples.english: Nobody but Einstein ﬁts the stereotypical image of a scientist.

examples.japanese: (h).学会に出席している学者は数人のほかは面識がなかった。
examples.english: All but a few of the attendees of the academic conference were  total strangers.
